content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This puzzle is not too easy and is a good subject, accessible to all, for a clash

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: My initial thought were that 'subsequence' term might mislead someone who are not familiar with problems like that and it would be good to have an explanation. But i think it's better to keep it that way, since tests are self explanatory. IMO this puzzle is nice and easy and has some golfing capabilities.

New things:

- Added double check to the unicity of the subsequence in the solution.
- With that found a bug with test "Right":

fishandchips
fish

where of course fish appears as a subsequence two times
fish-------- and fis-----h---

So I changed that test.
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!
Good one, not too easy, not too hard.
Simplified the previous statement (basically almost completely copy pasted @5DN1L wording suggestion) and wrote the solution in another language. Other than that is pretty much the same.
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!
It might look to complicated for beginners. But I'm guessing this ain't meant for them.

The first paragraph sounds overwhelming, while the second paragraph is a more short an concise version of it. Really, the second paragraph and few test cases might by enough.
But other than that, thank you for your contribution and please keep up the great work!

Goal section
* Please format a and b as variables.
* "such that" denotes cause and effect, which does not seem to describe the case here? I think both "such that" may be replaced with "and".
* It may be a bit difficult to understand the second sentence. Maybe it can be simplified like this?

You have to output the deletion string [[d]]. That is, [[d]] should be the same as [[a]], but where only the subsequence [[b]] is kept and all other characters are replaced with {{-}}.

Constraints section
* Please change "len" to "length".
* Please format a and b as variables only, whereas len() and * are excluded from the formatting.

Thanks.
Alright :thumbsup:, I fixed the constraints section and changed a bit the statement. It should be clearer now although the wording may be a little too mathy?
Please write a comment when you approve or reject a contribution. Thanks.
Erm... I think you need not rewrite all into maths-like language, just a bit of rewording is good enough, like the suggested wording in my last comment.

Well since I'm dumb and I didn't save the previous statement I'll let it as it is.

If others also find it too mathy or technical I'll try with your previous wording. Thanks !

I thought about suggesting splitting the points into bullet form but I did not. So it is good that you have done so to present the explanation more clearly. In case you decide to change the wording, the following is for your consideration:

You are given two strings [[a]] and [[b]] with:
- (1) length([[a]]) > length([[b]]), and
- (2) [[b]] appears as a subsequence of [[a]] once and only once.

You have to output the deletion string [[d]], which is the string that satisfies:
- (1) length([[d]]) = length([[a]]),
- (2) the subsequence [[b]] is kept, with its characters kept in [[d]] at the same positions as it appears in [[a]], and
- (3) all other characters are replaced with {{-}}.
